page.title: 08LILLESHALL ABBEY PONDS
page.content: There are three ponds at the{Abbey. They are not used any more but they used to be in use before 1547 by the monks before they were told or forced to leave the{Abbey.}Each pond was filled with fish. They were caught and eaten for dinner and supper.Two of the ponds are quite near to the{Abbey}but the third is nearer to{Lilleshall Grange.All the ponds are quite big but the pond by the Grange is a lot bigger than the other two.After the monks had left the{monastery}the ponds were abandoned. Now they, like all the rest of the Abbey ruins are only places to visit.
